Topic.Title: Once internet tax starts... ebay sales will plummet.

Message.Msg: Amazon gives a platform to sell just like ebay does. Ebay will be hurt more as it's Paypal division will hit with decreasing online sales. Why do you think ebay is sending emails to their users to fight the legislation?

Topic.Title: EBAy

Message.Msg: EBay's stock/investor reaction to earning is (my view) unexpected. 8% retraction from $58 on same forecast from 3 weeks ago -- seem strange (the same 17% - 20% growth) 3 year growth forecast. I expected Ebay stock to creep up to $60 after earnings and drop $6. 14 - 19% growth is not bad. Ebay stock is not predicatable Although the trend for last 9 months has been up until last week.

Topic.Title: Time to DUMP eBay!

Message.Msg: I think when it comes to ebay, most small sellers have long ago been impacted beyond endurance and this gathering of sales taxes will have little further negative impact. Sales taxes benefit roads, schools and more. No reason the internet should fly above the brick and mortar stores. Of course, there will always be criminals who pay no tax. Overall, it's great to see such a fine level of intelligent discourse in these comments below. Something badly lacking on this board. I hope that helps.

Message.Title: Shouldn't Ebay be pegged to a third of amazon valuation or $80s? Ebay is about a third size of Amazon
Message.Msg: And Ebay is making a profit, Stock was in $30s 10 months ago but has been growing at 15 - 20% Q over Q, Ebay still is growing at that pace.

Message.Title: Good Morning From Wonderful Philadelphia After Another Incredible Weekend
Message.Msg: Every day is becoming more and more spring-like. It's a wonderful time to be with ones family gardening. Hopefully the happy people know whereof I speak and enjoy their lives, and the unhappy few simply hold their tongues for once and contribute to the intelligent discourse. I hope that helps.

Message.Title: Ebay crashed down 10% on news of 15% to projected 19% growth.
Message.Msg: Earning could go to $3/share/year. why would that cause stock price to crash?

Message.Title: My ebay fees more than doubled. I don't care about the sales tax.
Message.Msg: I received an email from John Donahoe, and the first sentence reads- "Keeping costs down is a priority for any businessperson. That's especially true for people like youâ€”successful entrepreneurs and small businesspeople who know firsthand that every penny counts. But some lawmakers and large retailers want to impose more costs on you by mandating nationwide sales tax collection for your online business, whether you sell through eBay, other marketplaces, or your own site." What a hypocrite! My ebay fees DID more than doubled under this new and improved fee structure, and John Donahoe didn't care at all. But he thinks I should be concerned that my cost MAY go up because of an internet tax.

Topic.Title: Sales tax will run thousands of mom and pops off ebay

Message.Msg: Sales or use tax is due on all purchases made on Ebay and it always has been. The only thing that could be legislated is enforcement. Are you trying to stand up for tax cheats who think the rules that apply to bricks-and-mortar shops don't apply to them?

Topic.Title: Sales tax will run thousands of mom and pops off ebay

Message.Msg: What about all the Chinese mega sellers on eBay? You think they're going to be impacted by this bill?

Topic.Title: Shouldn't Ebay be pegged to a third of amazon valuation or $80s? Ebay is about a third size of Amazon

Message.Msg: Amazon has been honest in reporting their sales figures and earnings. The street is finally figuring out eBay has been cooking the books. Would be interesting to see a non-biased audit of both companies. Guaranteed, eBay is the Lance Armstrong of e-commerce.

Message.Title: Ebay downward trend
Message.Msg: Just another PII maneuver, Drop, drop, drop and then back up again. I would like to 50, but this price here is still a money maker.

Topic.Title: Sales tax will run thousands of mom and pops off ebay

Message.Msg: Yeah, right. They'll continue to skate. Still, I don't think it is fair for independent sellers who are in business to evade sales tax liability, and it bugs me when an enforcement measure is bashed as a "new tax".

Topic.Title: Sales tax will run thousands of mom and pops off ebay

Message.Msg: True enough, but that could change if the states get together and get behind federal legislation to change how sales tax is collected. It has been tried before and it has broken down because there are about eight thousand separate sales taxes in the USA and sellers without the right software program wouldn't have a clue how to comply.
